adrFormatAddress: 350 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary, upscale property offering terrace dining & a gym, plus a rooftop bar with city views.

originalText.text:
Hotel was easy to find and check in was relatively quick. We received cookies but there was no water - we ended up walking to Target to get drinks & snacks which is about 5 min walk away. We were worried about the lifts however we never had to wait long for a lift. The room was perfect for what we needed, comfy bed and a nice city view. We did have an issue with the bathroom (toilet) however after reporting it the following day we noticed the maintenance crew were sorting out a lot of rooms with the same issue - and later in our stay the water was turned off to resolve the issue.

You can hear a lot and the doors have big gaps underneath. We were able to hear a dog barking and anyone using the lifts. On our last night I was woken up and kept awake by a crazy who had somehow got into the hotel and was banging on all doors on our floor. He kept shouting through the doors to let him in - this went on for a few hours.

There are no vending machines but there is an ice machine.

The bed was really comfortable and the pillows - our room was quite hot but it was freezing outside. Housekeeping came daily which was nice.

We had breakfast one day and we opted for the buffet, the food and staff were very pleasant.

The location of this hotel is perfect - very quick walk to times square, subway etc..

One important note - the bell boy ordered us a taxi to the airport and a price had been agreed, once dropped off at the airport the fare was much more than advised.  The driver was also very offhand.

originalText.text: When one elevator was down, they closed another elevator to make it exclusive for the bar above. There was moments where that exclusive elevator was not in use, and it was still not available to hotel guests. When there are four elevators in your hotel, and one goes down, you don’t close another one as well. I paid for the hotel and its amenities and priority was given to non hotel guests going to some bar. This caused a massive, unnecessary line to take the only two elevators available. A line that took up the whole lobby and 25-30 minutes just waiting for an elevator to my room. That lobby was as crowded as times square. For a hotel that already has a lot of wait for elevators normally, the closing down of an elevator when another is down was just unacceptable. Plus 2 out of the 3 times I asked for cookies they were not available, so what sets Double Tree apart from the rest was not even there. And finally, the room I selected a night before my stay was changed 2 hours after the supposed check-in time of 3 pm for a room with a worse view. The only good thing that came from this stay was the service from the bell man Carlos. He is exceptional and honestly should not be working in such a poorly managed hotel that doesn’t care about their guests. He belongs in the best of hotels as he genuinely does care and provides the best of the best service. Hotel is next to a subway stop which is convenient, but it is situated in the exterior of times square in an ugly, unsafe area. Wouldn’t recommend to no one, and definitely wouldn’t return when I come back to Mew York.

originalText.text:
It's a good central location.  Easy to get to, quick elevators and a good staff.  Lots of construction around it but it worked as expected.

Bathroom was tiny and I couldn't get the motion sensing light to stop coming on.

The heat was fine but the fan didn't do anything so no white noise.

Plugs are all good and plentiful.  Quiet enough on the 15th floor.

You get what you expect a decent clean hotel for a decent price.  Nothing exciting nothing terrible.

originalText.text: Our first night we got no sleep as we could hear the music from the rooftop bar until 3:30am. The music was proper club music and made it impossible to sleep. The following morning we asked for a room change and they did so. This room although we could still hear some of the music at points, was much nicer and as a result we had a very good nights sleep. Staff were nice and the hotel was central to everything!

text.text: Our first night we got no sleep as we could hear the music from the rooftop bar until 3:30am. The music was proper club music and made it impossible to sleep. Staff were nice and the hotel was central to everything!

originalText.text:
Writing this review mainly to help other visitors. My opinion based on my experience.
You cannot really tell there is a hotel when you get there. You have to go in through an alley. Other hotels near by seems to be better looking. The lobby is not like a hotel lobby definitely not 4 star looking lobby.

Very hard to sleep for two main reasons
- Heater is very very loud (like an airplane taking off) kept me awake whole night.
-Room is not sound proof so you will hear people walking outside at night and you will hear the elevator beeping.
- There is a rooftop bar so keep that in mind while booking it gets noisy

Safety is a concern
- The location is not really good does not seem to be a safe neighborhood.
- I did not see any security at the main door. You will see someone in suite standing by elevator but they cannot control since the lounge is packed at all time.
- I have seen weird people in the lobby
- A lot of homeless people and some weird people right outside the hotel so not safe definitely not safe at night. Someone followed me to the hotel door.
- If you plan on going out at night this might not be the right place for you
- The lobby is always packed with people and they cannot control who is in the lounge who is not
- To get into the hotel you have to walk into an corridor

Cleanliness
- I would say it is more of a 3 star hotel cleanliness
- Stains everywhere on the wall of rooms
- The lobby is packed at all times and not really clean
- No complimentary water in room, soap bar instead of shower gel. But you do get a free cookie while checking in
- Housekeeping do change towels everyday and clean room
